data.title: What Happened in January 1982
data.meta_description: What happened in January 1982. Browse historical events, famous birthdays and notable deaths from Jan 1982 or search by date, day or keyword.
data.text:
Historical Events

11th Fiesta Bowl: #7 Penn State beats #8 Southern California, 26-10

Jan 1 30 Something stars Ken Olin & Patricia Wettig meet, later they marry

Jan 1 48th Orange Bowl: #1 Clemson beats #4 Nebraska, 22-15

Jan 1 48th Sugar Bowl: #10 Pittsburgh beats #2 Georgia, 24-20

Jan 1 68th Rose Bowl: #12 Washington beats #13 Iowa, 28-0

Jan 1 MTA launches a 5 year capital program to upgrade the NYC subway system

Pérez de Cuéllar Secretary General

Peru's Javier Pérez de Cuéllar becomes the 5th Secretary-General of the United Nations

Prayers for Poland

Pope John Paul II prays for an end to martial law in Poland

"Camelot" closes at Winter Garden Theater NYC after 48 performances

Jan 2 "The Epic in Miami", in 85 degree heat (Fahrenheit), the San Diego Chargers defeat the Miami Dolphins 41-38 in overtime in the AFC Divisional Playoff Game, a game that set numerous playoff scoring records

Navratilova Wins

Australian Open Women's Tennis: Martina Navratilova wins her 1st of 3 Australian singles crowns; beats Chris Evert-Lloyd 6-7, 6-4, 7-5

Jan 2 New York Islanders beat Philadelphia Flyers, 3-1 at Nassau Veterans Memorial Coliseum to start 23 NHL game undefeated home streak (21-0-2), 14 straight wins

Australian Open Men's Tennis: South African Johan Kriek wins first career Grand Slam title; beats American Steve Denton 6-2, 7-6, 6-7, 6-4

ABC Direction Network (57 affiliates) & ABC Rock Network (40 affiliates) become the 5th & 6th ABC radio network

Jan 4 Bryant Gumbel becomes co-host of NBC's "Today Show"

Jan 4 Chris Wallace becomes co-anchor of NBC's "Today Show"

Jan 4 San Francisco Bay's Golden Gate Bridge closed for 3rd time by fierce storm

Arkansas judge rules against obligatory teaching of creation

Sittler Leaves Maple Leafs

Star center Darryl Sittler leaves the Toronto Maple Leafs on medical advice because of mental depression; trade request was taking too long

Trottier's 10th Hat Trick

Islander's Bryan Trottier's 10th career hat trick

Jan 7 TV series "Fame", based on the film of the same name, starring Debbie Allen and an ensemble cast premieres on NBC TV

AT&T agrees to divest itself of 22 Bell System companies

Jan 8 Johnny Cash Parkway opens in Hendersonville, Tennessee

Jan 8 US Justice Department withdraws anti-trust suit against IBM, pending since 1969

5.9 earthquake in New England & Canada; 1st since 1855

Jan 9 Steve D'Innocenzo scores 3 hockey goals in 12 sec in Mass HS game

-17°F (27.2°C) in Braemar Grampian (equals UK record)

Jan 10 AFC Championship, Riverfront Stadium, Cincinnati: Cincinnati Bengals beat San Diego Chargers, 27-7 in the "Freezer Bowl"

Jan 10 NBC's premiere of TV film "Will: G. Gordon Liddy", based on the Watergate conspirator, participant and convict

The Catch

NFC Championship, Candlestick Park, SF: San Francisco 49ers beat Dallas Cowboys, 28-27; "The Catch" - iconic moment in NFL history - Dwight Clark makes fingertip catch for a TD from Joe Montana with 58" remaining; SF goes on to win Super Bowl

Jan 10 Petra Schneider swims world record 1500 m freestyle (15:43.31)

Atlanta, Georgia's temperature goes below zero F

Jan 11 Honduras adopts constitution

Air Florida 737 took off in a snowstorm, crashes into 14th St Bridge in Washington, D.C., & falls into Potomac River, killing 78

Baseball Hall of Fame

Hank Aaron and Frank Robinson elected to Baseball Hall of Fame

"Forbidden Broadway" by/with Gerard Alessandrini premieres in NYC

Jan 15 Mark Thatcher, son of UK prime minister Margaret Thatcher, makes his way home after 6 days missing in the Sahara

Fuhr's Unbeaten Streak Ends

Edmonton's rookie goaltender Grant Fuhr has his 23-game unbeaten streak end with a 7-1 Oilers' defeat in Toronto

"Cold Sunday" in the United States would see temperatures fall to their lowest levels in over 100 years in numerous cities

Lendl's 1st ATP

Czech tennis star Ivan Lendl scores a 6–7, 2–6, 7–6, 6–2, 6–4 win over American Vitas Gerulaitis to claim his first of 5 ATP Masters Grand Prix titles at Madison Square Garden, NYC

Aust-WI one-day game that produced a Privy Council libel case

Jan 19 Heater explodes at Star Elementary School, Oklahoma, kills 6 children & teacher

7 miners killed in an explosion in Craynor Ky

Jan 20 Future Hockey Hall of Fame center Darryl Sittler is traded by the Toronto Maple Leafs to the Philadelphia Flyers in exchange for Rich Costello, a 2nd round draft pick and future considerations

Osbourne Bites Head Off Bat

Heavy metal musician Ozzy Osbourne allegedly bites the head off a bat on stage in Des Moines, Iowa

Jan 20 Honduras constitution goes into effect

Jan 20 Piet Dankert elected chairman of European Parliament

"Little Me" opens at Eugene O'Neill Theater NYC for 36 performances

"Shaolin Temple"

"Shaolin Temple" martial arts film released, first Hong Kong feature filmed in China, directed by Chang Hsin Yen and starring Jet Li in his debut role

Jan 21 NY Islanders begin then NHL record 15 game winning streak with a 6-1 win over Pittsburgh Penguins at Nassau Veterans Memorial Coliseum

75% of North America is covered by snow

Urbe Blanca (cow) produces record 110 kg of milk, Cuba (approx date)

Jan 23 World Airways DC-10 skids at Boston Logan Airport killing 2

Super Bowl XVI, Pontiac Silverdome, Detroit, MI: San Francisco 49ers beat Cincinnati Bengals, 26-21; MVP: Joe Montana, SF, QB

9th American Music Awards

9th American Music Awards: Pat Benatar & Kenny Rogers win

For the first time since the 1930s, the unemployed population in UK rises above three million

Jan 26 In a 9-2 NHL win over Pittsburgh Penguins, the NY Islanders score 4 goals within 1:38, 5 within 2:37 in a 6 goal 1st period

Jan 26 Mauno Koivisto elected president of Finland

"Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat"

Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice's biblical rock opera "Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat" opens at Royale Theatre, NYC; runs for 747 performances

Jan 27 Los Angeles Kings set an NHL record with their 6th consecutive tied game, a 4-4 deadlock against the visiting Philadelphia Flyers

Jan 27 Mauno Koivisto installed as President of Finland

Phillies Trade Two for DeJesus

Philadelphia Phillies trade shortstop Larry Bowa & infielder Ryne Sandberg to Chicago Cubs for 2nd baseman Ivan DeJesus

Jan 27 Roberto S. Cordova installed as President of Honduras

Jan 27 West Indies beat Australia 3-1 to win cricket's World Series Cup

Italian police rescue US Brigadier General James Dozier, held hostage for six weeks by the Red Brigade of Padua, Italy

Jan 28 US performs nuclear test at Nevada Test Site

Old Dominion ends Louisiana Tech's women's basketball record 54-game winning streak

Jan 29 Wayne Garland, baseball 1st millionaire free agent, waived by Indians

39th Golden Globes

39th Golden Globes: On Golden Pond, Henry Fonda & Meryl Streep win

Jan 30 Richard Skrenta writes the first PC virus code, which is 400 lines long and disguised as an Apple boot program called "Elk Cloner".

Jan 30 US female Figure Skating championship won by Rosalynn Sumners

Benitez vs. Durán

WBC super welterweight champion Wilfred Benitez of Puerto Rico defeats boxing legend Roberto Durán of Panama in a 15-round unanimous decision at Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas

10 Arabian oryx (extinct except in zoos) released in Oman

32nd NBA All-Star Game

32nd NBA All-Star Game, Brendan Byrne Arena, East Rutherford, NJ: East beats West, 120-118; MVP - Larry Bird, Boston Celtics

Jan 31 Gustafson skates world record 10 km (14:26.59)

Jan 31 NFL Pro Bowl, Aloha Stadium, Honolulu, HI: AFC beats NFC, 16-13; MVPs: Co-MVPs: Kellen Winslow, San Diego Chargers, TE; Lee Roy Selmon, Tampa Bay Buccaneers, DE

Hamilton US Champion

US male Figure Skating championship won by Scott Hamilton

Famous Birthdays

David Nalbandian, Argentine tennis player (ATP Finals 2005; Wimbledon 2002 runner-up), born in Unquillo, Argentina

Jan 1 Egidio Arévalo, Uruguayan soccer midfielder (90 caps; Bella Vista), born in Paysandú, Uruguay

Athanasia Tsoumeleka, Greek race walker (Olympic gold 20k 2004), born in Preveza, Greece

Kang Hye-jeong, South Korean actress, born in Incheon, South Korea

Jan 4 Paulo Ferrari, Argentinian soccer defender (Rosario Central, River Plate) and manager (Rosario Central, San Martín SJ), born in Rosario, Argentina

Jan 4 Richard Logan, English footballer, born in Bury St Edmunds, United Kingdom

Janica Kostelić, Croatian skier, born in Zagreb, Croatia

Brian Bass, American baseball player, born in Pinehurst, North Carolina

Eddie Redmayne

English actor (The Other Boleyn Girl, The Theory of Everything), born in London

Jan 6 Gilbert Arenas, American basketball player, born in Tampa, Florida

Jan 6 Tiffany Pollard, American reality television personality, born in Utica, New York

Francisco Rodriguez, Venezuelan baseball player, born in Caracas, Venezuela

Jan 7 Hannah Stockbauer, German swimmer, born in Nuremberg, Germany

Jan 7 Ianina Zanazzi, Argentine racing driver, born in Buenos Aires, Argentina

Lauren Cohan

British-American actress (Maggie Greene-The Walking Dead; The Boy), born in Cherry Hill, New Jersey

Jan 7 Ruth Negga, Irish-Ethiopian actress (Loving), born in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia

Emanuele Calaiò, Italian footballer, born in Palermo, Italy

Jan 8 Gaby Hoffman, American film actress (Field of Dreams, Uncle Buck, Now & Then), born in New York City

Jan 8 John Utaka, Nigerian footballer, born in Enugu, Nigeria

Jan 8 Khaled bin Mohamed, Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi (eldest son of Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, President of the UAE),

Jan 8 Wil Francis, American horror-punk rock singer (Aiden), born in Seattle, Washington

Kate Middleton

Princess of Wales, English wife of Crown Prince William, born in Reading, Berkshire, England

Josh Ryan Evans, American actor, born in Hayward, California (d. 2002)

Ashley Taylor Dawson, British actor and singer, born in Manchester, United Kingdom

Jan 11 Son Ye-jin, South Korean actress, born in Sang-dong, South Korea

Chris Ray, American baseball player, born in Tampa, Florida

Jan 12 Dimitrios Tsiamis, Greek triple jumper, born in Karditsa, Greece

Jan 12 Dontrelle Willis, American baseball pitcher (MLB All-Star 2003, 05; World Series & NL Rookie of the Year 2003; NL wins leader 2005; Florida Marlins), born in Oakland, California

Jan 12 Hans Van Alphen, Belgian decathlete, born in Turnhout, Belgium

Jan 12 Paul-Henri Mathieu, French tennis player, born in Strasbourg, France

Jan 12 Sherzod Abdurahmonov, Uzbekistanian boxer

Guillermo Coria, Argentine tennis player (World #3 2004; French Open singles 2004 runner-up), born in Venado Tuerto, Argentina

Jan 13 Ruth Wilson, English actress (The Affair), born in Ashford, England

Caleb Followill, American alternative-rock vocalist and musician (Kings of Leon - "Use Somebody"), born in Mount Juliet, Tennessee

Jan 14 Léo Lima, Brazilian footballer, born in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

Jan 14 Víctor Valdés, Spanish goalkeeper, born in L'Hospitalet de Llobregat, Spain

Armando Galarraga, Venezuelan baseball player, born in Cumaná, Venezuela

Jan 15 Prince Philip and Prince Alexander of Yugoslavia, born in Fairfax, Virginia

(Samuel) Preston, British pop singer (The Ordinary Boys), born in Worthing, West Sussex, England

Jan 16 Birgitte Hjort Sørensen, Danish actress (Borgen, Pitch Perfect 2), born in Copenhagen, Denmark

Jan 16 Tuncay Şanlı, Turkish footballer, born in Sakarya Province

Alex Varkatzas, American heavy metal singer (Atreyu), born in Orange County, California

Jan 17 Amanda Wilkinson, Canadian country music singer, born in Belleville, Ontario

Dwyane Wade

American basketball player (Miami Heat, Chicago Bulls), born in Chicago, Illinois

Joanna Newsom, American harpist, born in Nevada City, California

Angela Chang [Zhang], Taiwanese pop singer ("Aurora"; "Invisible Wings"), and actress (At Dolphin Bay), born in Taoyuan, Taiwan

Jodie Sweetin

American actress (Stephanie Tanner-Full House), born in Los Angeles, California

Jan 19 Mike Komisarek, American ice hockey player, born in West Islip, New York

Jan 19 Pete Buttigieg, American politician, Mayor of South Bend, 1st openly gay Democratic presidential candidate, born in South Bend, Indiana

Dean Whitehead, English footballer

Fabricio Coloccini, Argentine soccer centre-back (39 caps; Deportivo La Coruña, Newcastle United), born in Córdoba, Argentina

Jan 22 Jason Peters, American football player, born in Queen City, Texas

Jan 22 Kevin Sheridan, American actor (Soul Man), born in Los Angeles, California

Wily Mo Peña, Dominican baseball player, born in Laguna Salada, Dominican Republic

Shawna Waldron, American actress, born in Glendale, California

Jan 25 Sho Sakurai, Japanese J-pop and hip-hop singer-songwriter, and actor, born in Tokyo, Japan

Adam Lambert, American singer-songwriter (For Your Entertainment, Trespassing), born in Indianapolis, Indiana

Jan 29 Heidi Mueller, American actress (Passions), born in Cincinnati, Ohio

Andreas Görlitz, German football player, born in Weilheim in Oberbayern, Germany

Jan 31 Brad Thompson, American baseball pitcher, born in Las Vegas, Nevada

Jan 31 Bruno Nogueira, Portuguese actor and comedian, born in Lisbon, Portugal

Jan 31 Elena Paparizou, Swedish-born Greek pop and rock singer-songwriter, born in Borås, Sweden

Jan 31 Yuniesky Betancourt, Cuban baseball shortstop, born in Santa Clara, Cuba

Famous Weddings

Dorothy Hamill

American figure skater Dorothy Hamill (25) weds singer and actor Dean Paul Martin (30); divorce in 1983

Danny DeVito

Actor Danny Devito (37) weds actress Rhea Perlman (33)

Famous Deaths

Margot Grahame [Margaret Clark], British actress (The Three Musketeers, Criminal Lawyer), dies from chronic bronchitis at 70

Jan 1 Paul Belmondo, French sculptor (Bathing Woman, Orleans), dies at 83

Jan 1 Victor Buono, American actor (Man from Atlantis: The, Untouchables; Batman - "King Tut"), dies at 43

Derek Sealy, West Indian cricket batsman (11 Tests; youngest West Indian Test player 17:122), dies at 69

Edmund Herring, Australian military commander, Lieutenant Governor of Victoria (b. 1892)

Jan 5 Hans Conried, American actor (Peter Pan; Bullwinkle Show; Make Room for Daddy - "Uncle Tonoose"; The 5,000 Fingers of Dr. T), dies from a heart ailment at 64

Jan 5 Harvey Lembeck, American stage and screen actor (The Phil Silvers Show; Stalag 17; Beach Party films), dies of a heat attack at 58

Bert Oosterhuis, Dutch motor racer (Paris-Dakar), dies in a race crash at 41

Jan 7 Eugene Wegmann, Swiss geologist (Le Jura plisse), dies at 85

Grégoire Aslan, American actor (The Return of the Pink Panther, King of Kings), dies of a heart attack at 73

Jan 8 Reta Shaw, American actress (Ghost & Mrs Muir, Mary Poppins, Picnic), dies of emphysema at 69

Lazar Weiner, Russian-born American composer, dies at 84

Jan 10 Paul Lynde, American comedian and actor (The Hollywood Squares, Uncle Arthur-Bewitched), dies after a heart attack at 55

Marcel Camus, French film director (Orfeu Negro), dies at 69

Red Smith, American sportscaster and columnist (Pulitzer 1976, Fight Talk), dies at 76

Harald Søltoft Agersnap, Danish cellist, pianist, conductor, and composer (Royal Danish Theatre, 1931-66), dies at 82

Burnet Corwin Tuthill, American composer (Laurentia), dies at 93

Jan 18 Trent Lehman, American child actor (Butch-Nanny & the Professor), commits suicide at 20

Elis Regina (Costa), Brazilian pop-samba-bossa nova singer ("Arrastão" - "Pull the Trawling Net"), dies from cardiac arrest after consuming alcohol, cocaine and tranquilizers at 36

Jan 19 Leopold Trepper, Polish-Israeli spy (founded CP Palestina), dies at 77

Marc Demeyer, Belgian road racing cyclist (Paris-Brussels 1974), dies at 31

Eduardo Frei Montalva, president of Chile (1964-70), dies at 71

Jan 22 Tommy Tucker [Robert Higginbotham], American R&B singer-songwriter, and piano player ("Hi-Heel Sneakers"), dies due to a poorly ventilated home improvement project at 48

Hope Hampton, actress (Star Dust, Lawful Larcency), dies at 83

Alfredo Ovando Candía, Bolivian president and dictator (b. 1918)

Mikhail Suslov, Soviet party ideologist and statesman, dies at 79

Iris Korn, American actress (Widder-Palmerstown USA), dies at 60

Félix Labisse, French painter (libidoscaphes), dies at 76

Jan 30 Riccardo Nielsen, Italian composer (99th Psalm; La via di Colombo), dies at 73

Jan 30 Stanley Holloway, English comedian (My Fair Lady, Our Man Higgins), dies at 91

Jiří Srnka, Czech classical and film score composer, dies at 74
